title: Very high ping spikes, unplayable. How to troubleshoot?
body:
Hello,

I have been playing league for a while and unfortunately have began to get pretty nasty ping spikes making the game pretty unplayable (jump from 80 ping to 450+ ping every 30 secs or so typically). I do not believe it is my internet however as I get consistent ping of 12-15 ms when pinging google (using ping -t www.google.com at the command line). If anyone could offer some first steps to trouble shooting this that would be awesome, thanks.

replies.body: It seems like your network can't hold on to a stable connection and even suffering from packet loss, which can cause sudden ping spikes like this.  I recommend running a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) for that match to know for sure.  The results may show that you have packet loss, but whatever it finds will also bring a set of troubleshooting steps specific to your issue.  Hopefully, that will help you get back in game!

Anything new in your home? Mac? router? ISP? Do you have a PC laptop to compare in the same household?
Try these Riot tutorials:
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool 
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues

Extra tip if you are Windows 10 user because ping can also be impacted:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/X6sPFPu8-fps-drops-and-crashes-after-the-windows-10-anniversary-update
